intro: Astragalus khayamicus, commonly known as the Khayam milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
